snippet: The legacy of Hugo Chávez, who died Tuesday, is not made of concrete and steel, highways and houses, but something less tangible: he has changed the way Venezuelans think.
abstract: Massive crowds gathering to observe funeral procession of former Venezuelan Pres Hugo Chavez testify to what may be his most lasting accomplishment--changing the way his countrymen feel about themselves and their nation; Chavez is thought to have given poor Venezuelans a sense of agency and inclusion in government that they had never before experienced.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: The legacy of Hugo Chávez, who died Tuesday, is not made of concrete and steel, highways and houses, but something less tangible: he has changed the way Venezuelans think.

headline.seo: Chávez Altered How Venezuela Views Itself
headline.main: Chávez Transformed the Way Venezuelans View Themselves
headline.print_headline: Chávez Transformed the Way Venezuelans View Themselves
